plot: The crew aboard the Russian ship, The Demeter, are locked in a life-or-death struggle to stop Count Dracula before he reaches England.

Lord Ruthven boards Captain Sokolov's line ship, the Demeter, bound for England. Like other passengers and crew, he is unaware its Transylvanian earth cargo includes Dracula. While newbie Piotr of Bavarian stock trains under the watchful cook, the count plays horrible, often fatal games with all aboard, apparently followed by a mystery mist. Sister Agatha learns all about the efforts to fight him magically.—KGF Vissers

Aboard a Russian ship bound for England, Dracula has craftily stocked it with an appetizing assortment of interesting and fulfilling passengers (including Sister Agatha) to shamelessly seduce before devouring their qualities and knowledge. As travelers and crew alike mysteriously disappear within their fog-shrouded journey, awareness comes that none may make it to shore alive, with the further horror that maybe none of them should.—statmanjeff
